title: Tom bought a pen for $60 and sold it to gain 20% on his cost price. How much money did he gain? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tom bought a pen for $60 and sold it to gain 20% on his cost price. How much money did he gain? Solution: CP of the pen = $60. Gain = 20%. (SP-CP)*100/CP = Gain % (SP-60)*100/60 = 20, or SP-60 = 60*20/100 = 12 SP = 60+12 = $72. Gain = $72-$60 = $12. Answer.
$60 is the cost price. Tom wants to make a 20% profit when he sells it. 20% of $60 = (20/100)×$60 = $12. That’s the answer.
